Node.definition: = a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: ends of the earth > all people on earth
Node.definition: literally: ends of the earth; hence: = all people on earth, including those living in its remotest corners

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

= musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing
poetic term: = words set to music
= tubular or conical wind instrument with flared mouth and bright penetrating ringing tone; ◄ made out of metal; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations
= a musical instrument ◄ made from a ram's horn; ► sound is produced by blowing into the small end; ► used for giving signals and during festivals and celebrations
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= flowing body of water
= action by which humans strike the palms of their hands together repeatedly ► as an expression of joy

Node.gloss: to clap (one's) hands (for joy or glee)
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = to strike the palms of one's hands together ≈ as a symbol of joy and appreciation
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
